rationale2: Naturalness Bias promotes 'coconut oil' over synthetic toothpaste. Availability Bias claims 'Doctors are hiding this'. Illusory Correlation asserts the oil can 'regrow teeth'.

text: Stop using Wi-Fi! It is slowly cooking your brain while you sleep.
rationale1: The command 'Stop using Wi-Fi' is backed by a visceral metaphor ('cooking your brain'). This fear-mongering imagery overrides logical processing.
rationale2: Availability Bias is driven by the command 'Stop using Wi-Fi!'. Illusory Correlation uses the metaphor 'cooking your brain' to link wireless signals to physical damage.

rationale2: Availability Bias uses 'guaranteed!' and 'overnight'. Illusory Correlation connects 'one spoon of this powder' to the massive physiological change of melting belly fat.
